_header: The King of heaven mid us be
_description: Homily on the Seven Deadly Sins — six-line stanzas

BLHar913.First Lines:
Þe king of heuen mid us beþe fende of helle from us
                    te…
BLHar913.Last Lines:
…And more loue of gode manAnoþer wol after
                    þan
BLHar913.Note:
The text starts on f. 48, and continues onto f. 22, ending on f.
                        22v. The verse moves from one verse line per manuscript line to
                    two verse lines per manuscript line, when it begins to discuss the sin of Pride
                    (f. 48v).

             Early English Poems and Lives of Saints.
Transactions of the London Philological Society
         1858; Pt. 2, Berlin, 1862: 17-20.
Heuser,  Wilhelm. 
             Die Kildare-Gedichte…
Bonner Beiträge zur Anglistik
         14. Bonn: P. Hanstein, 1904: 119-24.
